pullrequest.title: Fixed several bugs where custom zip groups were overridden.

content.raw:
Just to clarify this, in the first scenario, `global1` is in zip group 'test1' and `global2` is in zip group 'global1'?

If so, then yes, this is the \(approximate\) expected behaviour. That is, that we no longer override the fact that the user explicitly requested `global1` to be in a specially named zip group.

Potential improvements could be that `global2` is placed inside the specially named zip group for `global1`, or that `global2` is placed inside a zip group whose name is determined via a process that ignores parent globals with a user specified zip group name, however the code is complicated enough as it is... and it may turn out to be quite hard to do this without introducing another regression.
content.html:
Just to clarify this, in the first scenario, global1 is in zip group 'test1' and global2 is in zip group 'global1'?

If so, then yes, this is the (approximate) expected behaviour. That is, that we no longer override the fact that the user explicitly requested global1 to be in a specially named zip group.

Potential improvements could be that global2 is placed inside the specially named zip group for global1, or that global2 is placed inside a zip group whose name is determined via a process that ignores parent globals with a user specified zip group name, however the code is complicated enough as it is... and it may turn out to be quite hard to do this without introducing another regression.
